abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Road Projects for
            Botswana was successful. The projects achieved their
            objectives, their impact on institutional development was
            significant, sustainability is likely, and the performance
            of both the Bank and Borrower was satisfactory. Several
            lessons can be learned from these projects. First, RD and
            programs like DRMP will continue to be dependent on
            expatriate engineers and other professionals over the next
            several years due to a lack of local personnel. Second, if
            the projects had been approved after bids were opened for
            the major construction components, overestimation of costs
            could have been avoided. Finally, the projects could have
            benefited from more work on the non-construction components
            at the project preparation stage; preparatory work was only
            carried out on the major construction components.

docna.cdata!:
Botswana - Fourth Road Project : Loan 1408 -
            Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Botswana - Fourth Road Project :
            Loan 1408 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Highway Reconstruction Project will
            consist of: (a) construction of the Mahalapye-Serule road
            (150 km) to two-lane bituminous standards; (b) consulting
            services to: (i) assist the Borrower in bid evaluation and
            supervise construction of the Mahalapye-Serule road; (ii)
            assist the Borrower in the identification and preparation of
            a rural feeder road construction program; (c) assistance for
            road maintenance for: (i) gazetted roads: The
            recommendations of the Road Maintenance Study being carried
            out under the Third Road Project will be implemented; and
            (ii) district roads: The District Roads Maintenance Program,
            initiated under the Third Road Project, will be extended to
            two additional districts; and (d) provision of training
            equipment and construction of new classrooms and office
            space for the Roads Department Training School.
